article.headline: Creighton 77, Evansville 58
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Johnny Mathies scored 17 of his 26 points in the first half and Josh Dotzler added 15 to lead Creighton to a 77-58 victory over Evansville on Sunday. Anthony Tolliver had 12 points and nine rebounds and Dane Watts scored 10 points for Creighton (13-4, 7-2 Missouri Valley Conference). The Bluejays are 10-0 at home this season and are tied for first place in the MVC. Matt Webster scored 13 points to pace Evansville (5-12, 1-8). Bradley Strickland, Kyle Anslinger and Jason Holsinger added 10 points each for the Purple Aces, who are 0-9 on the road this season and losers of 18 straight away games since December 2004. The Bluejays scored the first eight points of the second half on a Dotzler layup, Watts' three-point play and a Mathies 3-pointer. That gave them a 15-point cushion. The Aces tried to rally behind a pair of 3-pointers by Holsinger and strong inside play by Webster but could come no closer than eight points. The deficit increased to 15 points on two more occasions before Creighton put the game away with a 13-0 run. The Aces went more than seven minutes without scoring and had only two points in the final eight minutes. The Bluejays led by as many as 12 points while taking a 39-31 halftime lead. They were down 11-9 before scoring 11 straight points, the final six in a span of 32 seconds. Mathies had his 17 points in the first 16 minutes, capped by a four-point play when he was fouled while hitting a 3-pointer.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
